reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 14, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars So many questions, so many twists, so many answers
reviews.reviewText: I picked this book at random after seeing it in the discover section of my Kindle Unlimited, I’m not even sure why. I read the synopsis and it seemed like it could be interesting. My first impression….Reading this book, wow, just wow. I have never annotated, talked out loud, dropped my jaw so many times while reading a book as I did with this one.The author is incredible at writing, and all of the little plot twists and things that make you wonder just make this book an amazing piece of work.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars A Riveting Tale of Deception and Desperation
reviews.reviewText: Alice Feeney delivers a heart-pounding domestic thriller in "Rock Paper Scissors." With masterful storytelling, she unravels a decade-long marriage, filled with secrets and suspense. The intricate plot, coupled with the emotional depth of characters like Adam and Amelia Wright, keeps you on the edge of your seat. Feeney's signature killer twist takes center stage, making this a must-read for fans of gripping psychological dramas.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Rock Paper Scissors
reviews.reviewText: This was the first book by Alice Feeney that I have read so I do not have another book of hers to compare it to- as far as her writing style. While it had a good twist at the end and the different perspectives from Adam and Amelia helped tell the story, it didn’t grab my attention (all the way through) like most books do.I’m sure that my review will not be the norm, but I didn’t care for all of the figurative language. I felt like every other sentence held a life lesson and it hurt the story. Sometime less is more. Do I think it would make a great screenplay/movie, absolutely, but I found myself skimming, scanning and sometimes skipping paragraphs just to get to the story and the end.I will admit that by the end I was just relieved that it was over. And the last chapter was just unnecessary.My version came with an excerpt of Daisy Darker so I will be reading more of Alice Feeney.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Refreshing Thrill Ride
reviews.reviewText: Undoubtedly one of the most gripping thrillers I've come across in ages, this edge-of-your-seat masterpiece had me burning the midnight oil to devour its nearly 300 pages. The worn-out phrase 'couldn't put it down' has never rung truer than with this novel. While the initial chapters unsettled me with an eerie vibe, I persevered, and I'm ecstatic that I did. The author skillfully weaves a tale filled with expertly positioned twists that unfold seamlessly, never feeling contrived. This riveting narrative keeps you on your toes, maintaining an air of suspense that lasts until the very last page.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Loved it but…..
reviews.reviewText: I really enjoyed this book as a cozy thriller winter read. I enjoyed the characters and read it in a day and a half.However …. * SPOILERS AHEAD *The ending seems kind of silly with him and his ex just getting back together and living happily ever after like nothing happened.The twists were intriguing though.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars What a mind game!
reviews.reviewText: I love a good book that keeps me guessing, and Rock Paper Scissors was exactly that! This was a story full of twists and turns that made me "oh my!" aloud on more than one occasion with actual, legitimate surprise. Just make sure your calendar is empty when you pick this one up because I guarantee you once you start it you won't wanna set it down until the very last word on the very last page has been read. Five stars all the way!!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I don’t know about you but I really enjoyed this book! I started to guess a few things based on the letters but this was NOT what I was expecting! So many hidden gems and twist and turns! Good book!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Characters are well developed, found myself both liking the main character and yet not being fond of her later self, only to learn... I can't say. You just need to read it! I was forming so many theories as I read and enjoyed how the final chapters reveal the truth. Well played, Ms. Feeney.
Llegó a tiempo y en perfecto estado

I haven’t read any of her other books, but this one was amazing! My wife and her mother read it as well, and none of us could put it down. Full of twists and mystery right to the end. Can’t wait to read her other stuff.
What a book !! And what a twist!! Totally enjoyed it . The twist was so unexpected that I had to go back a few pages and reread to understand the sudden development . Alice is really good !!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 3, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Rock Paper Scissors is the fourth novel by Alice Feeney, and it’s the second one that I’ve read. I was hooked by the intriguing premise: a couple in a troubled marriage who win a weekend getaway to a remote chapel in the Scottish Highlands. What could possibly go wrong?The story alternates between the present, where Adam and Amelia Wright are trapped in the chapel by a snowstorm, and the past, where we learn about their relationship through letters that "the wife" wrote to Adam every year on their anniversary. The letters reveal secrets, lies, and betrayals that have shaped their marriage, and they also hint at a shocking twist that will change everything.Feeney is a master of suspense and deception. She creates a claustrophobic and creepy atmosphere that makes you feel like you’re in the chapel with the characters. She also keeps you guessing with unexpected revelations and twists that make you question everything you thought you knew. The ending was just perfect: it was properly satisfying and very cleaver.I highly recommend it to fans of Feeney’s previous books, and to anyone who loves a good mystery. Such a brilliant read to kick off 2024!

I Am in the middle of reading it and all the pages are falling apart. I've had soft covered old books that are more resisting that this. Very low quality. Yes, I Am enjoying the story but it's hard when everytime I turn the page, another one falls..
